meanings.definition: To put someone or something in the place of another.
meanings.sent1: She replaced the broken toy with a new one.
meanings.sent2: The substitute teacher replaced Mrs. Smith for the day.
meanings.sent3: The magician replaced the rabbit with a dove, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her smile replaced the gloom in the room like sunshine breaking through clouds.
meanings.sent5: The missing puzzle piece was finally replaced, completing the picture.

meanings.definition: To take the place of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The new model replaced the old one on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: Technology has replaced many manual tasks in our daily lives.
meanings.sent3: The robot dog replaced the real one, causing confusion in the park.
meanings.sent4: His laughter replaced the silence, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The digital clock replaced the old analog one, ticking away the seconds.

meanings.definition: To restore or return something to its original position.
meanings.sent1: He replaced the book back on the shelf after reading it.
meanings.sent2: The janitor replaced the furniture to its original layout.
meanings.sent3: The wind replaced the fallen leaves back on the tree, a whimsical sight.
meanings.sent4: Her apology replaced the tension with understanding, easing the situation.
meanings.sent5: The caretaker replaced the fallen painting to its spot on the wall.
